allocationAmount.description: Enter the number of hours you want this resource allocated.Or, select Percent of Time in the dropdown and then enter the percentage you want this resource allocated over the selected time period.For example, a resource that typically works 8 hours a day for a 5 day work week is allocated 50% for two weeks would work on the project 4 hours per day for a total of 40 hours.
allocationAmount.name: allocationAmount

allocationResource.externalId.description: Select a resource for this allocation.Only employees and vendors identified as project resources are available for resource allocations. Check the Project Resource box on the employee or vendor record to identify a project resource.
allocationResource.externalId.name: allocationResource.externalId

allocationResource.internalId.description: Select a resource for this allocation.Only employees and vendors identified as project resources are available for resource allocations. Check the Project Resource box on the employee or vendor record to identify a project resource.
allocationResource.internalId.name: allocationResource.internalId

allocationResource.name.description: Select a resource for this allocation.Only employees and vendors identified as project resources are available for resource allocations. Check the Project Resource box on the employee or vendor record to identify a project resource.
allocationResource.name.name: allocationResource.name

allocationType.externalId.description: Select an allocation type.Hard – This allocation request is not flexible; the resource is committed to the dates and hours on this request.Soft – This allocation request is flexible; adjustments can be made to the date and hours if needed to accommodate other priorities.
allocationType.externalId.name: allocationType.externalId

allocationType.internalId.description: Select an allocation type.Hard – This allocation request is not flexible; the resource is committed to the dates and hours on this request.Soft – This allocation request is flexible; adjustments can be made to the date and hours if needed to accommodate other priorities.
allocationType.internalId.name: allocationType.internalId

allocationType.name.description: Select an allocation type.Hard – This allocation request is not flexible; the resource is committed to the dates and hours on this request.Soft – This allocation request is flexible; adjustments can be made to the date and hours if needed to accommodate other priorities.
allocationType.name.name: allocationType.name

allocationUnit.value.description: This field displays how this allocation is requested.Hours – A specific number of hours distributed over the selected dates is requested. Percent of Time – A percentage of time distributed over the selected dates is requested. NetSuite calculates the number of hours based on the resources work calendar and the selected dates.
allocationUnit.value.name: allocationUnit.value

approvalStatus.value.description: When you use SuiteFlow for resource allocation approvals, the forms now include an Approval Status field. The Approval Status field reflects the state of the transaction in the approval process.Resource allocations may have one of the following statuses:   1. Pending Approval – The allocation is in the approval queue.   2. Approved – The allocation has been given approval for processing.   3. Rejected – The allocation has not been approved and will not be processed.
approvalStatus.value.name: approvalStatus.value

customForm.externalId.description: If you customized a resource allocations form, select it here.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: If you customized a resource allocations form, select it here.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: If you customized a resource allocations form, select it here.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

endDate.description: Select the date you want this allocation to end.
endDate.name: endDate

nextApprover.externalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for resource allocation approvals, the form includes a Next Approver field. This field is populated based on the associated workflow. For example, in your workflow you may create a state of Pending Approval. In that state you create a formula to set the Next Approver as the resource manager.
nextApprover.externalId.name: nextApprover.externalId

nextApprover.internalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for resource allocation approvals, the form includes a Next Approver field. This field is populated based on the associated workflow. For example, in your workflow you may create a state of Pending Approval. In that state you create a formula to set the Next Approver as the resource manager.
nextApprover.internalId.name: nextApprover.internalId

nextApprover.name.description: When you use SuiteFlow for resource allocation approvals, the form includes a Next Approver field. This field is populated based on the associated workflow. For example, in your workflow you may create a state of Pending Approval. In that state you create a formula to set the Next Approver as the resource manager.
nextApprover.name.name: nextApprover.name

notes.description: Enter any additional information about this allocation.
notes.name: notes

numberHours.description: This field displays the number of hours requested in this allocation.If the allocation is requested using Percent of Time, NetSuite calculates the number of hours based on the requested percentage, selected dates, and the resource's work calendar.
numberHours.name: numberHours

percentOfTime.description: This field displays the percentage of time requested by this allocation. If the allocation is requested using Number of Hours, NetSuite calculates the percentage based on the requested hours, selected dates, and the resource's work calendar.
percentOfTime.name: percentOfTime

project.externalId.description: Select the project this allocation applies to.
project.externalId.name: project.externalId

project.internalId.description: Select the project this allocation applies to.
project.internalId.name: project.internalId

project.name.description: Select the project this allocation applies to.
project.name.name: project.name

requestedby.externalId.description: The person requesting this resource allocation is displayed here.
requestedby.externalId.name: requestedby.externalId

requestedby.internalId.description: The person requesting this resource allocation is displayed here.
requestedby.internalId.name: requestedby.internalId

requestedby.name.description: The person requesting this resource allocation is displayed here.
requestedby.name.name: requestedby.name

startDate.description: Select the date you want this allocation to begin.
startDate.name: startDate

type.value.description: Select a resource for this allocation.Only employees and vendors identified as project resources are available for resource allocations. Check the Project Resource box on the employee or vendor record to identify a project resource.
type.value.name: type.value
